org.cip4.elk.alces.jmf
Class JMFMessageFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.cip4.elk.alces.jmf.JMFMessageFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultJMFMessageFactory
public abstract class JMFMessageFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Defines a factory API that enables applications to obtain a factory for creating JMF messages.

Usage examples: 

 JMFMessageFactory factory = JMFMessageFactory.getInstance();
 
 // Create a JMF element
 JDFJMF jmf = factory.createJMF();
 
 JDFJMF jmf = factory.createJMF("QueryKnownMessages");

This class is thread save.

Author:
Claes Buckwalter (clabu@itn.liu.se)

Method Detail

getInstance

public static JMFMessageFactory getInstance()
Obtain a new instance of a JMFMessageFactory. This method uses the following ordered lookup to determine the JMFMessageFactory class to load:
  • Uses the org.cip4.elk.alces.jmf.JMFMessageFactory system property. The value of the system property is the fully qualified name of the implementation class.
  • Uses the first properties file org/cip4/elk/alces/jmf/JMFMessageFactory.properties found in the classpath. This configuration file is in standard java.util.Properties format and uses the same key as the system property defined above. Again, the property's value is the fully qualified name of the implementation class.
Once an application has obtained a reference to a JMFMessageFactory implementation it can use the factory to generate JDFJMFs.

Returns:
a reference to a JMFMessageFactory
Throws:
JMFMessageFactoryLoaderException - if the factory cannot be loaded

createJMF

public abstract org.cip4.jdflib.jmf.JDFJMF createJMF()
Creates an empty JMF node.

Returns:
a JMF node

createJMF

public abstract org.cip4.jdflib.jmf.JDFJMF createJMF(java.lang.String templateName)
Creates a JMF message based on the specified template name. An implementation could for example use xsi:type as the template name.

Parameters:
templateName - an identifier for the type of message to create
Returns:
See Also:
Specification 1.2, Table 5-2, xsi:type
